page.title: 05Fryerning - a personal view
page.content: Fryerning is very quiet, with hardly any traffic passing through. Instead vehicles travel on the A12 by-pass running parallel to Mill Green Road which cuts through Fryerning. Social life is poor for the younger generation. There are the pubs but no discos, parties or youth clubs. For community activities like sport and social functions one has to travel to Ingatestone or Brentwood (about six miles away). There is nothing to do in Fryerning except to walk about in the countryside, tend horses, ramble or go to tea with a next-door neighbour. Traffic can often be heard from the dual carriageway along with the noise of aeroplanes from above. There are no public buildings in the area though there is a water tower, a windmill and a few riding establishments.
